content: Where was the 16th President of the United States, Abraham Lincoln, born?

Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was born in a one-room log cabin in Hardin County, Kentucky, on February 12, 1809. His parents were Thomas Lincoln and Nancy Hanks Lincoln. The cabin where he was born has been reconstructed and is now part of the Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historic Site, which is located near Hodgenville, Kentucky.
